snippet: The showdown in Ukraine has revived a centuries-old debate over when secession is legitimate. Nations’ views vary greatly, depending on their own alliances and interests.
abstract: Showdown in Ukraine's Crimea region is reviving centuries-old debate over when secession is legitimate; situation recalls the Kosovars' secession from Serbia in 1999, which the United States supported and Russia opposed, and underscores reality that nations' views regarding sovereignty versus self-rule vary greatly depending on their own alliances and interests.
lead_paragraph: The showdown in Ukraine has revived a centuries-old debate over when secession is legitimate. Nations’ views vary greatly, depending on their own alliances and interests.

headline.main: Sovereignty vs. Self-Rule: Crimea Reignites Battle
